 The squash showed extremely difficult to extract and the 31-year old woman had to be transported to the hospital, where it was finally removed after a delicate two-hour surgery.
 The security guard who intercepted the pumpkin thief described the incident as â€œextremely disturbingâ€ and the worst thing heâ€™s seen since he started doing this job 13 years ago.
 Sonia Smith now faces two charges of shoplifting and disorderly conduct, but she could be judgedÂ unfit to stand trial dueÂ to her long history of psychiatric problems.
 The young woman has already made several stays in mental institutions across the state since 2009.
 A source close to her family has confirmedÂ that she suffers from schizophreniaÂ and â€œhears voices that command her to insert various objects in her body cavitiesâ€.

Title: Florida: Babysitter tied crying one-month-old baby to ceiling fan for 26 hours
Content:
Nora Jackson, 28, was contacted and hired on Craigslist to take care of a one-month-old baby after the parents had planned to take a day off.
 Parents of the one-month-old child contacted the Orlando PoliceÂ Department when they arrived at their residence to find their baby had been tied and suspended from the ceiling fan.
 Camera surveillance footage contradicted Nora Jacksonâ€™s story that she had only suspended the child to the ceiling fan for a few minutes, but instead for 26 hours straight, commented Deputy Sheriff Neil James.
 Although the child is currently under medical watch, doctors believe the baby will not suffer from any permanent damage.
 Nora Jackson finally admitted that she was intoxicated and under the influence of crystal meth, alcohol and crack cocaine before she decided to suspend the one-month-old baby to the ceiling fan to stop him from crying.
 Jackson also left the home during the night to attend a party elsewhere and lost the keys and addressÂ to the house where she had left the baby.
 Orlando police later arrested Jackson at her home where she first denied being hired on Craigslist as a babysitter but later admitted to the whole story.
 Jackson is now facing multiple accounts of child abuse and neglect and could face up to 15 years in jail if convicted.

 â€œI just took a few tokes becauseÂ I was bored and wanted to stay awake,â€ she told Officer Johnson.
  â€œAll I remember is that I started getting really hungry, ate some chicken wings and passed outâ€ she admitted in tears.
 The 3-month-old child was found in the microwave, covered in barbecue sauce, and was rushed to Springfieldâ€™s Mercy Hospital where doctors do not fear for his life.

 â€œTeeth marks were found on the babyâ€™s arms and legs but luckily he is unharmedâ€ he acknowledged, visibly distraught by the whole affair.
  The state of Missouri has led, forÂ more than a decade, the nation in methamphetamine busts.

Title: Two CIA Agents Arrested by Minutemen while Crossing Mexican Border with 1300 Pounds of Cocaine
Content:
The volunteers were completely astonished when the two arrestees pulled out CIA ID cards and explained they were actually carrying the drug as part of their duties and that the cargo belonged to the Central Intelligence Agency.
 The incident took place last night, in the ChihuahuanÂ desert, near the Texan city of El Paso.
 A group of seven Minutemen saw a large black SUV drive rapidly across the border. They chased theÂ vehicle in their own trucks and achieved to immobilize it after a chase of more than 15 miles.
 The vigilantes arrested the two men on board and called the border patrol, whoÂ proceeded to searchÂ the vehicle. They discovered dozens of packages of cocaine, totaling an incredible 618.4 kilograms (1363 pounds).
 The search of the vehicle revealed 36 packages of cocaine, all marked withÂ the symbol of the Sinaloa Cartel, representing a black scorpion.
 The two men claim to be CIA operatives based in Mexico andÂ explained that theÂ drug was actually part of an operation of the agency.
 They presented identity cards that seem to validate their claim, butÂ the CIA spokesperson, Dean Boyd, has officially denied any linkÂ between the organization andÂ the two men.
 Both the border patrol officers and minutemen seem unconvinced, however, and many of them seem to believe that the secret service agency is hiding something.
 The U.S. custom services have even announced a thorough investigationÂ to try and verify the two menâ€™s story.
 TheÂ custom servicesÂ have confirmed that the two men, who canâ€™t be identified due to the Intelligence Identities and Protection Act of 1982, did carry valid CIA identifications and that the vehicle was indeed registered as a service vehicle of the organization.
 The two men remain under the custody of the customs services at the moment and are still being interrogated in a facility near El Paso.
 They are facing charges of possessing, trafficking and importing illegal drugs, and could face other criminal charges once the investigation is over.
 Both the FBI and the DEA have announced that they would collaborate with the U.S. Customs and Border Protection in this case, which as already attracted a lot of attention in Southern Texas.

Title: Drug mule arrested after diarrhea ejects cocaine in middle of airport
Content:
27-year old Tania Smith, from Fort Lauderdale in Florida, was getting ready to board a plane back to the United States after spending two weeks in Brazil when the incident occurred.
 The young woman looked visibly ill and feverishÂ while waiting in line before boarding, and several witnesses said kept groaning and swearing loudly.
 At the moment she was called up to present her ticket, she suffered a severe incident of diarrhea which ejected dozens of drugs pellets from her rectum, directly on the airport floor.
 Ms. Smith was immediately arrested and a cavity search revealed more drug packages, bringing the total to 104 pellets.
 An examination of the pellets indicated she had over 1kg in weight of cocaine in her body, for a street value of more than $100,000.
 She confessed that he had been offered a 2-week trip in Brazil by a man in Florida in exchange forÂ bringing the cocaine back from Rio de Janeiro toÂ Miami.
 According to the Lieutenant Igor Rosario di Pablo of the Brazilian federal police, she suffered from Travelerâ€™s diarrhea during her entire trip and was still sick when she inserted the drugs in her anal cavity.
 Lieutenant Di Pablo and police director Rosario Perreira Franco described this arrest as one of the easiest and most scatty of their careers but insisted that drug smuggling was a very seriousÂ problem and nothing to laugh about.
 Tania Smith was charged with drug transportation and trafficking. She faces from 30 years to life in jail if convicted.
 Dozens of individuals like her are arrested every year while smuggling drugs across borders for drug cartels.
 These â€œdrug mulesâ€ often use body cavities to hide the drugs, and some die every year after the packages break and release the drugs in their bodies.
 Considering the risks associatedÂ with this process, Ms. Smithâ€™s severe diarrhea may have gotten her arrested, but it might also have saved her life.

 Another witness, Justin Reynolds, says he tried to help his classmate, but was kicked by the infuriated teacher.

 Her lawyer, Robert Monroe, says that her violent reaction was due to the fact that she was being harassed by Mr Dunlop on a regular basis.
 Mr Monroe claims that Ms Fransen is in fact the victim in this story, and that she â€œtemporarily lost contact with realityâ€ as a result of the harassment.
 She is expected to appear in court in May, but her lawyer has already announced that she would plea â€œnot guiltyâ€.

Content:

Title: Kenya: Authorities Release Barack Obamaâ€™s â€œRealâ€ Birth Certificate
Content:
These official papers had been requested for years by theÂ Tea Party Patriots, an American conservativeÂ organization, to no avail, butÂ the Kenyan Supreme Court recently ordered authorities to release the documents,Â based onÂ a law on â€œaccess to information.
 These files, if they turn out to be verifiable, could mean that Mr. Obama had no legal right to become the American president under the countryâ€™s law.
 The papers released today suggest that Barack Obama was actually born on March 7, 1960, in Lamu,Â Kenya, more than a year before his father moved to Hawaii, where heÂ allegedly met his mother.
 This contradicts most of the documents presented by the presidential office over the last years, suggesting that either the American or the Kenyan papersÂ are actually faked.
 The official version of Barack Obamaâ€™s birth presented by the White House in the pastÂ was that heÂ was born on August 4, 1961, at the Kapiâ€™olani Maternity & Gynecological Hospital (now called the Kapiâ€™olani Medical Center for Women & Children) in Honolulu, Hawaii.

 Mr. Obama Senior was attending the University of Hawaii at the time, where he supposedly met Ms. Dunham.

Title: Mexico: 200 Pounds of Cocaine Found in Washed Up Whale
Content:
The discovery of large bags of cocaine washed up on the shore completelyÂ baffled local authorities and led to an immediate autopsy ofÂ the large sea mammal estimated to weigh over 160 tons.
 The large shipment of cocaine, which is the largest quantity of cocaine to ever wash ashore in the region, has resulted in an international inquiry led by the Mexican government in cooperation with the US Drug Enforcement Agency to investigate into the matter.
 Officials proceeded to an autopsy of the whale after deflating the carcass, which was bloated with methane gas, and could have exploded, before extracting more than 200 pounds of cocaine from the whaleâ€™s stomach
 Specialists believe the smugglers lured the giant mammal with a dead giant squid as bait, as the bags of cocaine seemed to lay inside the digested remains of a squid.
 â€œNever have I had to deal with such a situation in my 23 year careerâ€ explains DEA officer Robert Grant.
 â€œLetâ€™s hope they learn this as a lesson and donâ€™t try this pathetic attempt againâ€ he said, visibly furious.
  A street value estimated to over $9.6 million
 If the bulk value of the cocaine has been estimated at $2,455,000, however, if broken down and sold, the street value is over $9.6 million, estimate experts.
 The cocaine is linked to the Gulf Cartel by experts
 â€œThe packages were all stamped with a dolphin logo, indicative of narcotics belonging to the Gulf Cartelâ€ explains local police chief, Juan Roberto Gonzalez.
 â€œIt is a tragedy that they are using animals to do their dirty business, we hope an international investigation can prevent such incidents from happening againâ€ he told a local news crew.
 Last May, a similar shipment was found on the seashore of Galveston,Â Texas, whereÂ 66 pounds of cocaine were discovered by authorities.

Title: 101-Year-Old Woman Gives Birth After Successful Ovary Transplant
Content:
The illegal and controversial surgical operation was done in a private clinic in Turkey, where European laws on ovary transplants do not apply, admits the centennial mother who does not wish to disclose the name of the clinic where the operation was undertaken.
 â€œI am very grateful to all the team of doctors who decided to go on with the operation,â€ she admitted in tears.
 â€œFor so long I have felt useless to God, I could not procreate since I turned 48 years old when I was diagnosed with ovarian cancer. For a long time I believed God was punishing me for only bearing 16 children, but in his godly generosity, he has granted me with fertilityÂ once again,â€ acknowledges the century-old fervent Catholic.
 Dr. Alexandro Popolicchi fully endorses the controversial ovary transplant, which is deemed illegal under European health laws, and which was undertaken in a private clinic in Turkey where such laws do not apply
 Although he admits the procedure is highly controversial, Dr. Popolicchi believes the ultimate decision was up to his patient to make.
 â€œWho am I to judge if it is the proper thing to do? She has given birth to a beautiful baby and this miraculous birth is definitely a gift from God!â€ he told reporters.
 â€œSo many children are born in this world unwanted or by accident. Is it not a beautiful thing to know this child comes to life in a loving home?â€ he asked reporters.
 Although Miss Vertadellaâ€™s husband has passed away sinceÂ 1998, the century-old widow has managed to find a sperm donor to make the birth possible.
 â€œI met Francescoâ€™s father on the internet while trying to find a father to my child. This 26-year-old man is a Catholic and that is all that is important to me. I wanted my child to be born in a union sanctified by the Catholic churchâ€ she explained.
 â€œI know we are not married and that he will not play a part in Francescoâ€™s life, but I have written to the pope to ask for his absolution. I have also named my child after the pope in his honor and so I believe he should find a place in his heart to forgive me in this particular situationâ€ she added with a prayer.
 â€œI still love my deceased husband and desire to stay a widow until I leave this earth, but I needed the seed of this young fervent Catholic to fulfill Godâ€™s will,â€ she concluded.
 Malegwale Ramokgopa allegedly gave birth to her 25th and 26th child in 1931 at the venerable age of 92
 The worldâ€™s oldest mother was previously believed to be Malegwale Ramokgopa, aÂ woman born in South Africa in 1839 who allegedly gave birth to twins three days after celebrating her 92nd anniversary on October 3, 1931, which made nation-wide headlines at the time.

 Official documents of the Pickett family released at the auction included documents confirming the death by tuberculosis of George Pickett at the tender age of 16.
 The death of the only boy of the family of eight possibly devastated his father, Colonel Robert Pickett, who dreamed of leaving a family military legacy behind him.
 â€œIt was not uncommon at the time to fake documents or steal someoneâ€™s identity.  Mary Sue Pickett, who was George Pickettâ€™s senior by one year, was also known to suffer from aÂ rare genetic disorder known asÂ hypertrichosis, a condition where an excess of androgen creates a hormonal unbalance that results in female beard growth.

Title: China: Billionaire Killed By Champagne Bottle Cork
Content:
Hong Kong| 49-year old Dingxiang Loeng, a well-known and very flamboyant Chinese businessman, died this morning in his suite of the Island Shangri-La hotel during a reception he was holding for his birthday. According to some of the 217 witnesses of the tragedy, it is while opening a champagne bottle that the billionaire was hit violently in the temple by the cork, an accident that caused a fatal brain hemorrhage.
 The accident took place during a sumptuous party that was being held to celebrate Mr. Loengâ€™s 50thÂ birthday, thatÂ would have taken placeÂ on August 2nd. Nearly 200 guests were present, including most of Hong Kongâ€™s political and economic elite, when the celebrated, after a brief speech, opened a bottle of champagne and was hit violently in the headÂ by the cork. Many witnesses actually laughed at first, greatly underestimating theÂ severity of the injury, Â but an eerie silence rapidly overcame the crowd as Mr. Loeng remained unconscious and the medical staff was urged on the site. Despite all the effortsÂ of the paramedics, his death was confirmed less than twenty minutes later while he was being carried to the hospital.
 Many of the guests who had laughed at first, were visibly emotional after the announcement of Mr. Loengâ€™s death.
 Rated the 51st richest in Hong Kong according to the Forbes business magazine, Mr. Loeng was an eccentric real estate tycoon who made a fortune in some veryÂ controversial deals in the years preceding the transfer of sovereignty of the former British colony to China. Even if his fortune is estimated at more than 1 billion dollars, the Hong Kong businessman was always better known for his various anticsÂ  and legal problems than for his economic activities.
   He was notorious for hisÂ drinkingÂ habit, drug problems and bad temper, having been arrested more thanÂ thirtyÂ times over the years for various charges, including public drunkenness, disorderly conduct, disturbing the peace, driving under the influence of alcoholÂ and assault onÂ a hotel doorman.
 According to the police, the champagne bottle could have been a Chinese counterfeit, an explanation that seems more than plausible for the exceptionally high level of carbon dioxide contained in it. The problem of counterfeit alcohol has become a major concern for the Chinese authorities over the last few years, as the quantity of forged liquors and wines has been soaring. Many experts estimate that as much as 80 per cent of the alcohol inÂ most Chinese citiesÂ is fake, mostly using counterfeit branding, where spoiled, low grade bottles of wine are sold as the real deal, yielding unreal margins.
 TheÂ owners and staff ofÂ the hotel, Â refused to comment the event or the accusation of selling couterfeit alcohol.
 A champagne cork in full flight wonâ€™t kill you , but it can pop an eye out of itâ€™s socketâ€¦.

Title: Saudi woman dies after husband leaves her in car for 10 hours
Content:
According to Saudi authorities, Fiza Haifeh died ofÂ hyperthermia after spending more than 10 hours locked up in her husbandâ€™s car, with the temperature hovering around 45 Â°C (113 Fahrenheit)Â much of the afternoon.
 Her husband told officers that heÂ didnâ€™t have timeÂ to drop his wife off atÂ home before going to work andÂ that he forgot to open a window like he usually did when he left her in the car.
 The temperature inside the car is believed to have rapidlyÂ reached overÂ 70 Â°CÂ (158 Fahrenheit). Stuck inside the car for hours at such temperatures, theÂ womanÂ had no chance of survival.
 Saudi Interior Ministry spokesman Maj. Gen. Mansour al-Turki,Â told reportersÂ that no charges would be filed against Fiza Haifehâ€™s husband, since her death was unintentional.
 Every year, approximately 2500 people die of hyperthermia across the world after being left in vehicles.
 The majority of these victims are elderly people or young children. In the Arabian peninsula, however, more than 75% of the victims are adultÂ woman,Â whoÂ are left inÂ cars by their husbands or brethren.
 In Saudi Arabia alone, the numbers of heatstroke deaths of women in cars averages 37 a year,Â with aÂ record of 49Â in 2010.
 According to Human Rights Watch, these women prefer to remain in the vehicles and endure unbearable heat rather than exiting and facing possible arrest and physical punishment.
 Although womenâ€™s rights have been incrementally extended in recent years, women who walk alone in the streetÂ still face up to 50 lashes if they get caught.

Content:
AbdullahÂ al-Rashidi, 26, was tending to the herd of camels when he was caught performing a fellatio on one of the animals before local authorities were called in and proceeded to his arrest.
 Al-Rashidiâ€™s employerÂ first hesitated before calling the police but said he could not tolerate such an act of perversion before God and that his employeeâ€™s actions needed to be punished.
 â€œWhen I found him licking the camelâ€™s penis, he first told me that he was drinking the sperm from the camel to cure his oral herpes infection,â€ his employer told the judge.

 Drinking camel urine is reputed to have many health benefits but sperm is not known to have any curative powers admit experts.
 Judge Muhammad El Fehdi expressed his moral disgust towards the young man, warning him that he had not only disgraced himself but his entire family before God.
 â€œHow ashamed your father and mother must be and how much they must regretÂ givingÂ birthÂ toÂ a son who enjoys fondling the genitals of camels,â€ the judge said in court.
 Al-Rashidiâ€™s parents also pleaded the judge to give their son a harsh punishment so as to deter him from repeating the offense.
 Under intenseÂ questioning from the judge,Â the defendant admitted that it was not hisÂ first offense but that he had taken part in such activitiesÂ previously a number of times.
 â€œI donâ€™t know why I did it. I knew it was wrong but I could not resist,â€ said the young man, bursting into tears.
 â€œYou are a young man who is startingÂ your life, and so I will give you a light punishment, but if you are to repeat this immoral and disgraceful practice, next time I will be less lenient,â€ the judge told the young man.
 AbdullahÂ al-Rashidi was sentenced to 1,000 lashes and two months in prison. According to Shariah law, in the case of bestiality, the animal becomes â€œunfitâ€ and must be killed.

Title: Doctors Confirm First Human Death Officially Caused by GMOs
Content:
This surprising announcement comes after the autopsy ofÂ the 31-year old Spanish man who died at the Madrid hospitalÂ at the beginning of January.
 The young manâ€™s health rapidly deteriorated after he suffered an unexplained allergic reaction, and allÂ theÂ drugsÂ used to refrain theÂ anaphylaxisÂ were entirely inefficient.
 The team of expertsÂ claims toÂ have been able toÂ determine thatÂ the genetically modified tomatoes that theÂ victim ingested at lunch were the cause of the allergic reaction that caused his death.
 Mr. Ramos was working as aÂ clerk in a Madrid warehouse on January 7,Â when he started feeling ill just after lunch.
 A number of symptoms started to manifest themselves,Â including a violentÂ itchy rash, some serious swellingÂ of the throat andÂ a drasticÂ drop inÂ blood pressure.
 The man, who was known to have allergies, quickly injected himselfÂ some epinephrine, but hisÂ health condition continued to deteriorate.
 The young man was rapidlyÂ carried to the hospital by co-workers, but the medical staff was unable to identify the cause of hisÂ allergic reaction in timeÂ andÂ none ofÂ the usual treatmentsÂ orÂ drugs seemed to work. Mr. Ramos was confirmed dead just over an hour after arriving at the hospital.
 The young man appeared happy and healthy when this picture was taken by his roommate, less than 24 hours before he died.
 TheÂ medical examiners and forensic expertsÂ at the Carlos III hospital had to execute a lot of tests and analysis before they could precisely determineÂ what causedÂ Mr. RamosÂ to die of an allergicÂ reaction to seafood since all he hadÂ eaten before his death wasÂ a bacon, lettuce and tomato sandwich with a diet cola.
 They wereÂ astonished when they discovered that the tomato he had ingested, not only containedÂ some fish-related allergens, but also some antibiotic resistant genes which hadÂ prevented Mr. Ramosâ€™ white blood cell fromÂ saving his life.
  â€œAt first we thought that thereÂ had beenÂ some form of contamination of his food, from contact with fish or seafood during the preparationâ€ explained Dr. Rafael PÃ©rez-Santamarina.
 Many experiments on GMOs had produced some horrible tumors and event death in rats and other lab animals, but most genetically modified products on the market were considered to be harmless to humans.
 TheÂ case of Mr. Ramos is the first human death officially confirmed to be linked to the ingestion of genetically modified food.Â It contradicts most studies on GMOs which hadÂ concluded that genetically engineered crops currently on the market were completelyÂ safe to eat.
 A team led by University of Nebraska scientists had anticipated this kind of problem in 1996 when they found that a Brazil nut protein introduced to improve the nutritional quality ofÂ genetically modifiedÂ soybeans was able to provoke an allergic reaction in people with Brazil nut allergies.
 However, this kind of problemÂ was dismissed by most scientists as very improbable, since it could easily be avoidedÂ with proper safety testing.
 The soybean injected with the Brazil nut gene was indeed abandoned during development, but it seems that the genetically modified tomato that caused Mr. Ramosâ€™ death had not been submitted to sufficient testing and the lethal risk had not been identified before it was marketed.
 The Spanish Ministry of Health, Social Services, and EqualityÂ ordered for the tomatoes of Portuguese origin which infected the young man,Â to be recalled and removed fromÂ stores and markets for safety reasons.
 More than 7,000 tons of tomatoes will, therefore, be ceased across the country by ministryÂ inspectors and public safety officials.
 The ministryÂ also issued a public statement about the death of Mr. Ramos in which it sends its condolences toÂ his family and addsÂ that it will
  â€œimmediately demand further research on the subject to determine if other genetically modified food products on the European market could represent a risk for the Spanish populationâ€
 .

Title: Boy Raised by Kangaroos Discovered in Australia
Content:
Many sightings of the boyÂ had been reported by variousÂ ranchersÂ of the regionÂ over the lastÂ months, and he hadÂ even drawn some attentionÂ from the local media.
 TheÂ child had beenÂ reported toÂ accompany aÂ mob ofÂ red kangaroos, which seemed to have adopted him as one of their own.
 Officers of the federal police were finally able to capture him this morning, 16 kilometers outside of Broken Hill.
 He was taken to the hospital immediately after his captureÂ and was placed under theÂ custody of agents fromÂ the Department of Child Protection.
 â€œWe are trying to establish the actual age and identity of the boyâ€ explains
  Australian Federal Police Commander, Glen McEwen
 .
 The kangaroos accompanying the child were very aggressive towards the AFP officers when they approached the young boy. Many of them even attacked the policemen, forcing the officers to use tranquilizing darts.
 The young boy was allegedly traveling and living with a group ofÂ a dozenÂ kangaroos in the western regions of the province of New South Wales.
 A few ranchers had reported seeing him around their property, scavenging various fallen fruits, seeds and nuts.Â BackÂ in April,Â a man from SilvertonÂ even claimed to have seen him on his property, grazing fresh grasses and forbsÂ with other kangaroos.
 â€œHe seems to have spent most of his day, resting in the shade, coming out at night to gather food and find some water.â€
 AFP Commander, Glen McEwen, admitted that he was very skeptical when he had received the first reports concerning a feral child near Broken Hill.
  â€œI really thought it was a hoax,â€
 he told reporters.
  â€œIn fact, I had doubts until I saw the boy myself.â€
 The boy is apparently aged betweenÂ 4 andÂ 6Â years old, and seemsÂ surprisingly healthy considering the fact that he was living with animals. He suffers obvious signs of malnutrition, as well as severe sunburns, butÂ he seems to have developed normally and to beÂ in rather good shape.
 A complete medical examination will, however, be necessary to determine precisely his physical and mental condition.
 The boy doesnâ€™t seem able to understand any human language and is visibly scared of other humans, suggesting he could have been living in the wild for many years.
 He isÂ terribly scaredÂ of other human beings and tends to react violently when approached, soÂ his rehabilitation is expected to be a long and difficult process.
 The Australian Federal Police launched an investigation to determine the identity of the child and the circumstances of his disappearance.
 They are asking anyone who couldÂ possess information which could be useful in the case, to contact the AFP as soon as possible.

Yes, the kangaroos are his adopted family, and the little guy is sure a survivor, but I donâ€™t think he should be left to survive in those harsh elements. I think they should find a tribe that will take him in and let them tend to his nourishment and care, rather then him being poked and prodded and studies.

Title: Indonesia: Zoo Keeper Accused of Impregnating Female Orangutan
Content:
The 38-year-old zoo keeper was filmed in full action by a series of hidden cameras put in place by the zooâ€™s security officials after doubts emerged about the manâ€™s devious actions towards the zoo animals.
 â€œSome animals seemed sexually aroused when it was time to feed themâ€ explains Akhiroel Yahya, employee of the zoo for 14 years.
 â€œBut what made us most suspicious was when we discovered Marylin, our oldest orangutan, was pregnant. She has never been in contact with any other orangutans because of her aggressive nature, so it didnâ€™t make any senseâ€ he acknowledges, visibly troubled by the news.
 The Surabaya zoo authorities became highly suspicious when Marylin, the zooâ€™s eldest female orangutan, was found pregnant three months ago
 The zoo officials admit it took them sometime before being able to explain what had actually happened.
 â€œAt first, we clearly did not comprehend what had happened,â€ admits the zooâ€™s director, Abdoel Hakim. â€œMarilyn has been secluded for the past 10 years, it was a total mystery,â€ he acknowledges.
 â€œIt is only when we placed several hidden cameras that we learned the horrible truthâ€ he admits, visibly angered by the whole situation.
 When confronted by local authorities, the offender denied any wrong doing on his part.
 â€œHe said everything he had done was consensual,â€ explains police chief Abubakar Jaar. â€œHe said he loved each and everyone of the animals and was very sorry he had impregnated the orangutan,â€ he told local reporters.
 â€œHe says he did not know orangutans could get pregnant from humans,â€ he added.
 If many experts believe the man could not have impregnated the female orangutan, some specialists claim a rare genetic predisposition could explain the unexplainable.
 Paleobiologist Bachtiar Pado Panghulu of the University of Jakarta claims orangutan DNA is extremely close to human DNA
 â€œContrary to popular belief, the orangutan species is much closer to the human species than chimpanzees. We share practically the same DNA code, with only minute differences, which could explain the orangutan falling pregnant from this manâ€ explains Paleobiologist Bachtiar Pado Panghulu, of the University of Jakarta.
 â€œParticularly in Indonesia, the genetic profile of some of the population is extremely close to the orangutan species, leading us to believe theyâ€™re might have been a common ancestor to both species only a few hundred thousand years ago,â€ he admits.
 Surabaya zoo, Indonesiaâ€™s largest zoo, repeatedly made headlines in 2012 because of its scandalous treatment of its animals after
  a former employee of the zoo claimed that over 50 animals had died at the zoo during the three months since he had been hired.

Title: Retirement home raided by the FBI for running elderly fight club, 7 arrests

 The fights were filmed and relayed online on a specialized website, where they often attracted several thousand viewers and astounding amounts of money in bets.
 FBI spokesman, Bill Donovan, says the most popular fights were the ones in which contenders were â€œarmedâ€ with canes or walkers.
 Officer Donovan says the staff used several different methods to force the residents to fight, either by through rewards or punishment.
 According to the FBI, the organizers of this illegal combat ring may have pocketed over $125 million over the 3 years it was in operation, mostly from online bets.
 The FBI confirmed it has seized a lot of computer hardware in the Retirement Village as well as several other pieces of evidence like video cameras blood-covered walkers.
 The two owners of the retirement home and five other employees were arrested for the role they played in the organization.
 The five employees each face numerous criminal charges and could face sentences going from 45 to 85 years in jail if found guilty on all charges.
 The owners of the retirement home, Terence and Michelle Aniston, respectively face 37 and 31 accusations and could face over 300 years in prison.
 Their trial is expected to begin at the end of June and should draw a lot of media attention.

 He had just finished extracting the poor man from the narrow container when the paramedics arrived a few minutes later.
 Tom Dunmore,Â  whoÂ saved Mr. Morrisonâ€™s life, told MSNBC that heâ€™d found many strange things in mailboxes over his 30-year career, but this was â€œby far the most disturbingâ€.
 Fortunately,Â the medical staff was able to stabilize Mr. Morrison after a few hours of intensive care, and he regained consciousness the next morning.
 According to doctors, he broke his left thumb and his right foot, but should suffer no long-termÂ physical consequences from his misadventure.
 Mr. Morrison says he fell in inÂ the box on Friday morning while attempting to mail a letter and was unable to get out.
 He claims the accident was inÂ part due to the fact that the mailbox was almost 40 years old and wasnâ€™t as safe as the new ones.
 In fact, some employees of the U.S. postalÂ services replaced it only hours later be a new one, suggesting this claim may be at least partially true.
 Walter Morrison says heâ€™s considering filing a lawsuit against the U.S.P.S. but first wants to take time to recover from his ordeal.

Title: China: Miner Found Alive After 17 Years Underground
Content:
While they were exploring the galleries, they stumbled upon Cheung Wai, a 59-year-old survivor from the 2001 accident,Â obviously in aÂ rather bad shape.
 Wai was immediately taken to the hospital where a complete evaluation of his physical and mental states will be done over the next weeks.
 The poor man had remained trapped underground with the bodies of 78 of his dead coworkers after an earthquake of a magnitude of 7,8 hit the region and caused the wooden supportÂ structure of the mine to crumble and collapse.
 Wai managed to survive thanks to an emergency stash of rice and water, stored in an underground depot, conceivedÂ especially for this kind of case.
 Even though Wai was suffering from great physicalÂ and mental stress, he managed to give proper burials to all of his comrades, spending almost a year in this great selfless act.
 Mining accidents remain common in China, despite growing measures by the government to reduce the problem, which killed more than 4000 miners a year at the beginning of the millennium.
 Over the last years, the authorities haveÂ been cracking down on manyÂ unregulated mining operations which account for almost 80Â percent of the countryâ€™s 16,000Â mines.
 The closure of about 1,000 dangerous small mines last year helped to cut in half the average number of miners killed, to about six a day, in the first months of this year,Â according to government statistics.
 The former record for surviving underground was of 142 days and was held by a British man named Geoff Smith. He had been voluntarily buried in the backyard of the
  Railway Inn
 , his favorite pub, with the intention of breaking the record.

Title: Saudi Prince loses $350 millions and 5 of his wives in 6 hours at the casino
Content:

 According to the director of the casino, Ali Shamoon, the prince pawned his wives in exchange for $25M in credit and left them there after he lost.
 Pawning or selling women is rather rare practice but it is still legal in several Middle Eastern countries.
 The high profile of these particular women appears to embarrass both the Sinai Grand Casino and the Egyptian government, however, and a diplomaticÂ solution remains quite probable.
 It is still unclear what will happen to the Princeâ€™s wives and if they will be able to return to Saudi Arabia, and most experts believe that other members of the Saudi Royal family could buy them back discretely over the next few weeks.
 If not, they will likely be sold at auction in a few months, probably in Yemen or Qatar.
 Egyptian Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry said his government would do everything it could to facilitate the Saudi womenâ€™s return to their homeland, as soon as their husbandâ€™s debt will be paid.
 This isnâ€™t the first time that Prince Majed bin Abdullah bin Abdulaziz Al Saud attracts attention for bad reasons.
 In 2015, the Saudi Arabian prince was accused of a having sexual relationship with a male aide, taking cocaine and threatening to kill women who refused his advances â€“ as well as sexually assaulting a maid.
 A few days after the facts were revealed by the media, Los Angeles County prosecutors announced that they would not be filing charges against theÂ prince and heÂ was allowed to leave the country.
 This time, however, the prince is believed to have lost the vast majority of his fortune, so he may finally calm down and adopt a more conservative lifestyle.

Title: Fisherman Captures 3,000-Pound Great White Shark in Great Lakes
Content:
John Oâ€™Keefe, a Canadian tourist, captured the 3,000-pound beast while fishing for sturgeon in Michigan Lake.
 â€œWe reeled in the beast for a good 4-5 hours before we finally shot it and wounded it to the headâ€ explains the Toronto resident on vacation.
 â€œLuckily, IÂ had my rifleÂ in hand, or else this prize fish wouldâ€™ve never been caughtâ€ claims his friend, a long-time resident of Chicago, Allan Brooks.
 John Oâ€™Keefe, a Canadian tourist and Toronto resident, captured the 3,000-pound beast while fishing for sturgeon in Michigan Lake yesterday
 The great white shark estimated at more than 1,5 tons isÂ the biggest fish ever caughtÂ in the region, believe experts.
 â€œEither rising sea temperatures andÂ depleted fish stocks possibly led the shark to adventure itself further into the Great Lakes region, but this is clearly the first occurrence of such a beast in the region that I can remember ofâ€ he admits, visibly puzzled.
 â€œIt is also possible it traveled to the region through underwater tunnels that interconnect between the Great Lakes,â€ he told reporters.
 Authorities suspect that more than a hundred people reported missing in the areaÂ in the last decade mayÂ have fallen under the fangs of the gigantic beast, several local residents even suspecting its presence for a long time.
 Local campground owner, Robert Helm, says he had warned authorities about the series of disappearances to no avail
 â€œIâ€™ve owned this campground for the past seventeenÂ yearsâ€ explains local entrepreneur, Robert Helm.
 â€œIâ€™ve had my load of visitorsÂ disappearing mysteriouslyÂ over the years, but I was told not to say anything about it. People would check in, but they wouldnâ€™t check out,â€ he recalls. â€œNobody everÂ believed meÂ anywayÂ andÂ it wouldâ€™ve scaredÂ away the tourists,â€ he told local reporters.
 â€œIt wouldâ€™ve been bad for business in townâ€ he adds, visibly relieved since the capture of the largeÂ creature.
 U.S. Coast Guard spokesman Sidney Johnson reassured local residents that the occurrence of such a predator in the regionâ€™s waters â€œis highly unlikelyâ€ as sharks are notÂ well adapted to freshwater systems, dealing great damage to their kidneys and respiratory system.
